So I pretty much short term trade only apple when it was hot and Starbux as I got in on the IPO and added with each split, but I will dump any stock as soon as it turns, no sentimental, just make money. If airbus was not 100% better than Boeing over the last 3 years and it was the another company then I would be doing that . I like to make money and limit my loss. This is what I mean be careful of the barkers they tell you a story, look at the stock chart it does not fib to you. Next look who is the CEO that is a good way to handicap a stock , Elon Musk, is a serial billionaire, James McNerney , is a serial average CEO. This new guy for Airbus in the USA sure looks good, so that is a big plus for Airbus. He is not a Musk, but much more disciplined , with better skill set , related to aerospace than James McNerney. The Airbus CEO for the Americas is a military fighter jet pilot, a engineer, he ran a airline, was head of the FAA and a real American military hero . Topic.Title: Second United Dreamliner diverted with oil-related problem

Message.Msg: Don, if you own Boeing stock, then, since Boeing is responsible for any late delivery, fire, oil filter issue, false warning light, not meeting specifications of a clean not reworked plane like the 787, or , , smoke in the flight deck or fire on the tarmac, or failure of a 787 product , then you as a stockholder and your investment is held liable, it causes stock value depreciation . For the last 3 years Airbus stock has bettered Boeing stock in share increase of value, by more than 100% than Boeing stock. So if Airbus was held up with all the problems of the 787 then Airbus shareholder's would be responsible or if you prefer their stock value would not be as good as Airbus. That is what that means . If you own Boeing stock you are responsible , you are a owner of Boeing , Mr McNerney , like you or me is an employee of Boeing or a retired employee. Also he is a owner of Boeing if he and you have stock in Boeing. So if you have a cost basis as you have said so low your happy to own Boeing that is your choice. As a shareholder you are the owner and your are responsible for any failure of a Boeing product. Apple was great until Steve jobs died I owned Apple until it was about 700 per share then watched it start to slide and when Steve Jobs died I got out and waited as I did not want to be responsible as a owner of the company stock for what might happen with a new leader, glad I did that too. Steve jobs I liked , he paid himself 1 dollar per year and the rrest he made on stock price appreciation. James Mcnerney I do not like he has so much pay and benefits he does not care if boeing makes it or not. Don remember how wel all complained that McNerney got so much money before he set foot at Boeing there was zero incentive for the mane to produce any good result and he has not been good , go figure . I sold my shares at over $90 during the 747-400 when Frank said he would bury airbus by selling 747-400 at less than cost.

In a letter penned by the Treasury, James Underwood of the Rights Unit, provides answers to three questions penned by Alexander Baron of the Digital Journal. In his May 7th letter, Baron asked whether George Osborne, Britain’s head finance minister, would attend the Bilderberg meeting held in Watford from 6-9 June. He also asked in what capacity Osborne would be attending and who would be paying for his expenses. Message.Title: It's Nice To Be Fair and Balanced
Message.Msg: Male Fox News guest to female Democratic consultant: “Know your role and shut your mouth” Bill Cunningham also asked Tamara Holder, "Are you going to cry?" By David Bauder A finger-pointing political argument on Fox News Channel boiled over when a male conservative talk show host shouted at a woman to “know your role and shut your mouth.” The man, Bill Cunningham, later asked Fox contributor Tamara Holder, “Are you going to cry?” Fox on-air personalities on Friday were talking about the exchange on Sean Hannity’s prime-time show the night before. Commentator Juan Williams concluded that Cunningham “obliterated the line” of civil discourse in his argument with Holder. The two had been brought on by Hannity to discuss whether Attorney General Eric Holder — no relation to Tamara — had committed perjury. Cunningham, sitting next to Tamara Holder in a New York studio, called her “one of the stooges of the left that will always be there to excuse away criminal behavior.” He said she had the “incurable fatal condition of liberalism that caused people like Eric Holder to be the consulary of Barack Hussein Obama.” He was jabbing a finger at Holder, who returned the favor. “I really hope that when you speak to a judge, you don’t point your finger in the person’s face the entire time,” she said. “Your finger does not make your point.” Cunningham is a former assistant attorney general in Ohio whose wife is on the Ohio Court of Appeals. He hosts radio and television talk shows. “Whose finger is in my face right now?” Cunningham asked. Replied Holder: “Mine, because I’m telling you to shut up.” “You shut up!” Cunningham said. “Know your role and shut your mouth.” Cunningham could not be reached for comment Friday. It was only three weeks after another exchange on Fox, where daytime host Megyn Kelly said she was offended by a male colleague’s suggestion that children of working mothers don’t fare as well as children with stay-at-home moms. One Fox contributor, Erick Erickson, said that in nature, males were traditionally dominant. Later, Cunningham repeated his assertion that Holder was a “liberal stooge and an excuse-monger for the Obama administration.” After Holder paused, Cunningham asked, “What, are you going to cry?” “No, I’m not going to cry,” Holder said. Admonished by Hannity at the end of their segment to shake hands, they refused. “I don’t shake hands with trolls,” Holder said. Things were still smoldering on Friday when Fox returned to the argument. Daytime host Martha McCollum hosted a segment with Williams and Fox contributor Mary Katherine Ham on whether the combatants had gone too far. “The merits of the argument might be on the Cunningham side,” Ham said, “but I’m on Team Tamara on the comment of knowing your role.”

Message.Title: regaring Sonwden and the Espionage
Message.Msg: There is no doubt that there was espionage involved, and serious stuff at that. There may have been a claim to whistle blower status early on, but when the secrets about other countries started, it changed to something else. So what is espionage? Webster and other have definitions that a team of lawyers could debate. It stealing secrets for sure. Wikipedia has a more complete and probably usable description. {{{{Espionage or spying involves a government or individual obtaining information considered secret or confidential without the permission of the holder of the information. Espionage is inherently clandestine, as it is taken for granted that it is unwelcome and, in many cases illegal and punishable by law. It is a subset of intelligence gathering, which otherwise may be conducted from public sources and using perfectly legal and ethical means. It is crucial to distinguish espionage from intelligence gathering, as the latter does not necessarily involve espionage, but often collates open-source information.}}}} Using this definition Snowden did it. Using this definition the NSA also did it. Sure NSA with try to hide in the last half of the def. and claim intelligence gathering. That dog won"t hunt. Does any informed citizen think the NSA was amassing information on them for national security reasons? Or were they a organization out of control. One the could operated without regards or constraints. Take Puget Sound or any other area or even nationally. If this Snowden could have any info he desired simply by a couple of keyboard strokes. Lets say he was a political activist, who wanted to help is party or desired candidates succeed. Or say he was criminally inclined who wanted improve his financial success in the markets and a number of other ways. Perhaps a blackmailer, or into using his position for mischief or harm to people. There is just unlimited opportunity for misdeeds. Continued

Message.Msg: This claim that NSA is only looking at phone numbers. That they are not listening or reading. That thewould have to get a court order in order to do that. If you believe a single word of that, then you are truly lost. Time to speak up or sit down and shut up.

Topic.Title: Kenyans rant Online as Obama Skips Father's Homeland on Africa Trip

Message.Msg: Wow, this is beyond desperation. This is what you have??? Too funny.....
